title: Suno Research
description: My journey in mobile development is defined by solid experience with React Native and Apollo CLI, where I had the opportunity to create and refine innovative applications. On the back-end, I contributed significantly by implementing new features using the robustness of GraphQL. Additionally, I focused on ensuring code quality by working with E2E testing through Appium and unit testing with Jest, always prioritizing excellence and efficiency in the development process.

I actively contributed to the development of a mobile application using React Native, focusing on creating an intuitive and user-friendly experience. A key feature of this app involved extensive work with Maps and Location Services, allowing users to navigate seamlessly and optimize their experience.This project encouraged a balance between creativity and technical expertise, as we tackled a real-world problem faced by professors. The application, named SisCarona, was specifically designed to facilitate carpooling for UNESP professors, fostering community connections while offering a practical and efficient solution to daily transportation challenges. Through this journey, I not only deepened my expertise in React Native and geolocation tools but also honed my skills in problem-solving, team collaboration, and addressing user-specific needs with innovation and precision.
